com.example.shoutout.activity.fragment

Class ProfileFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.shoutout.activity.fragment.ProfileFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class ProfileFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    Fragment displaying a user's profile information and a timeline of their most recent posts. The specific information shown is the following:
    • Avatar
    • Display name
    • Username
    • Birthday (may be unset)
    • Biography (may be empty)
    • Join date
    • Number of people this user follows
    • Number of people following this user
    • A follow/unfollow button (if you're not looking at your own profile)
    • A small timeline showing the user's most recent posts
    • A button allowing the timeline to expand to show earlier posts
    Since:
    April 29, 2021

                                          User loggedInUser)
        Creates a new instance of this fragment.
        Parameters:
        viewedUser - The user whose information will be displayed in this fragment
        loggedInUser - The user that is currently logged in and using this app
        Returns:
        A new instance of this fragment
        See Also:
        ProfileFragment

      • setIsPostLikedListener

        public void setIsPostLikedListener(PostFragment.IsPostLikedListener listener)
        Set the listener for when this fragment needs to check if a post in this user's timeline has already been liked by the local user. Important: This should be set before the fragment is attached to the parent activity.
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener to check if a post from this user has been liked by the local user
